Issei is a regular high school student. He attends classes, hangs out with friends, and obsesses over girls. In fact his obsession of more of a sick perversion. What he doesn’t realize is that there is a war brewing. A war between Heaven and Hell and before he knows it, Issei gets caught up in the middle of it. When a near-death experience causes him to end up on the side of the Devils, Issei must now adjust to his new life while at the same time trying to please his busty and beautiful Devil Mistress.
 With taglines such as “Punctuated With Boobs” & “Fueledby the Fires of Perversion!”, it shouldn’t come to anyone’s surprise that Highschool DxD is a very Mature rated anime. The Anime is full of fan service – with every female character ending up naked at one point or another throughout the series – and it has a lot of American Pie style perverse humor with the main character, Issei, talking about “whacking it” or calling breasts “fun pillows” and the like. However this only serves as the show’s main source of humor. Past the nudity, there is a legitimate storyline that is surprisingly deep and well written.


The overall storyline is as follows: High school student Issei is attacked by a Fallen Angel and nearly killed. He is rescued by an upper classmate, the beautiful red-headed Rias. It is revealed that Rias is a member of the Gremory family – a family of Elite, Pure-Blooded Devils. Rias saves Issei’s life by turning him into a Devil like herself. The rest of the Anime revolves around Issei getting used to his new life as a Devil as well as trying to prove himself worthy to Rias.


The one thing that really stood out for me with this anime was the characters. I honestly expected many of the characters to fall into the cliches that I’ve seen with other ecchi (sexual) anime but luckily that was not the case. I did not expect Issei to become a genuinely loving, protective, and compassionate individual. Even though there are moments where he is distracted by breasts, he never lets that get in his way as he fights for the safety of those he cares about.


On the same token, the story isn’t some played out love-drama where several female characters are all fighting for Issei’s affection. There are only two women in the series who are interested in Issei but they do not let their feelings get in the way of their lives. They do not obsess about him nor fight one another for Issei’s affection. It is a nice change of pace from those other anime where we suffer through nine beautiful women who are all falling over one another for one boys attention.


The storyline itself is split into two distinct arcs. The first arc revolves around Issei’s membership into the Devils and the trials he must go through to help those he cares about. The second arc surrounds Rias and her ties with another Devil family. Both of these arcs last between 3-4 episodes. The episodes in between act as both filler and character development – none of which drag the series down or bore the audience. These episodes help build the characters’ relationships with one another while at the same time providing Issei some time to train and grow as a devil.

I didn't read a review about Highschool DxD as I simply stumbled upon it because of a typo on google but it is probably 1 of the best mistakes I made in my life. 


It has action, it has well made fight scenes and the romance gets interesting as the story progresses. The anime sticks close to the LN and I can say that it stays over 90% true to it, it only covers LN 1 and 2, so if you want to know how the story goes after the anime, read the LN as there are 12 at the moment. 


Now, what they did well with the anime was that they explained everything very well and only when the situation asked for it, so no massive amount of information at once that blows your mind into 100 pieces and you have no idea what is happening, another point where this anime scores well with, is that even though it is very ecchi, it isn't done over the top and not like other animes, that they did it at the most random moments, it is mixed well with the story and what surprised me most is that, sometimes they even have their reason to be that ecchi with the main protagonist.


Another point that I would like to let you know: Highschool DxD uses a lot of Norse, Japanese and Greek Mythologies, it would be useful if you know something about them but if not, don't worry as everything will be explained as the story progresses.


Art: The anime is well made concerning art, the background is accurately made and the character design is nothing unique, but nonetheless well done as their is no weird face design, nor are there characters with physics breaking hairstyles.


Sound: Personally I enjoyed the opening theme, in fact I even downloaded it. The ending theme is lets say...interesting, the animation that goes with the themes go well with what kind of atmosphere this anime has and probably simply to joke around as most people would have thought at the beginning of the anime that it would be as ecchi as it could get.


Where my 9 is based on mostly, is that the BGM is absolutely top notch, fighting scenes have a truly amazing tune that will get you all fired up, and romantic scenes have a well fitting tune as well, believe me when I say that if you would look for a playlist with them, that you won't regret it. It is truly well done and the composer is a genius in my opinion. another point, the BGM isn't repeated over and over again, almost every scene has it's own piece of music.


Character: Here is where Highschool DxD scores amazingly well, my opinion might be slightly biased as I read up to LN 5 and the character development is astonishing, the depth that the characters are described is amazing and something that I have never seen before, but don't get me wrong here, the characters in the anime have their fair squire of development already.


Now let's go a bit into more into detail;


Issei Hyoudou: Our perverted main protagonist who gets killed on his 1st date, quite sad actually, not knowing that his master would be Rias(buchou) and will revive him as a devil because he has a 'sacred gear' that could even kill gods. I won't go too much into detail as it would spoil things and that's not what a review should do.


Rias Gremory: The sweethearted, beautiful and 1 of 2 the school's 'onee-samas,' 1st in line to become the next head of the Gremory household, kind hearted to her 'slaves' but when someone makes fun of them or during training she changes into an absolute tsundere and will put herself to her limit.


Asia Argento: The kindhearted, blonde nun that will undergo absolute change if you read the LN..absolutely hilarious scenes will happen because of this, believe me. 


Akeno Himejima: The other half of the 'onee-samas' and a complete sadist, also called the 'priestess of lightning.' She doesn't undergo any development through the anime though, but she certainly has her comedic part in the anime. 


Yuuto Kiba: The 'prince of the high school' and seems to enjoy to annoy Ise by being too close to him, because of his good looks he is hated by Ise.


Koneko Toujou: The loli in this anime, is the idol of the school because of her tiny body and cute looks, doesn't talk a lot but when she does say something, it is generally to say something when Ise did something perverted. 


The many supporting characters certainly add to the story and give a comedic breeze to the anime, all in all every character has his own contribution to the story and anime.


Enjoyment: I certainly enjoyed this anime and will watch this anime for a 3rd time for sure. It has a high re-watch value and actually an anime that every single person should have watched, or read the LN. 


Overall: No matter what you are into, harem, ecchi, action, supernatural, it has something for you.


So stop reading and go watch it, and when you are done go read the LN, it will entertain you till the last bit.


Thank you for reading and please, as I stated at the beginning: let me know what I did well and what I should improve.

Goddamn it, not even panties and an even more embarrassing pose, LMAO!"

The main character is a totally pathetic pervert. He becomes demon slave to one of the high-level demons. Turns out he has some god killing weapon sealed in his body. He's wound up in a war between angels, demons, priests and whatnot as he struggles to unlock the potential of his weapon. The jokes they try to make with the pervy main character are... eh, pathetic. There’s an art to the ecchi genre. Sexual appeal may not require brains to react to, but it requires skill. Not everyone can be a stripper or a sexy dancer even if you have the right body. A good ecchi show would know symbolism and psychology aren’t part of the genre. It would know that it uses sexuality and energy to tell a fun, ridiculous story. High School DXD knows this, but doesn’t work on it.
The characters embodies the strengths and the weaknesses. Rias is worth all the hype and posters they made. You need more than big breasts to make a sexy character. Riasis sexy and not just because of her figure (which isn’t easy to design. See also: Divergence Eve). It’s also little touches like the hair, which is deliberately red. Red is both the color that attracts the most attention. Rias isn’t just meant to be pretty but she symbolizes sexuality.


Her posture, behavior and personality also help express this idea. She’s not a caricature nymphoniac who’ll be a sex slave for our main character. Rather, she’s comfortable in her sexuality. She doesn’t mind being seen naked. She’s in a position of authority that gives her a lot of power but she’s not drunk with it. Power is sexy, but being able to control it is harder and sexier.


She’s a charismatic, powerful presence that holds the series despite the fact everyone around her is barely half as interesting. What’s weird is that all the failures are females. They’re supposed to be just as attractive as Rias, but they’re dull.


It’s hard to see something in them beyond archetypes. Rias was an embodiment of an idea. Everyone else is a dull archetype. Asia is the complete opposite of Rias, which is something. It’s not used to its advantage. The contrast between the two never appears. We know she’s a nice girl but we only know it. We rarely see it happen. Akeno has no personality whatsoever and Koneco is a quiet loli, which was always a terrible idea and doesn’t improve here.


The designers do have talent. Later in the series a rival group is introduced, and they all have more imaginative designs than the main characters’. It’s almost as if they had two different designers, and the less creative one punished the other. Things in the rivalry team include spiral twintails, X-shaped twintails, a bikini armor and a masked figure. Even at their worst, there’s more spark to their design. Why do the main characters get the generic long hair of Akeno?


The male characters are actually more entertaining this time. They’re often mindless perverts or boring good guys in such shows. Issei is a combination of both, but it’s one that works. He has these attributes not because it’s convenient to the story but because they can create a personality out of it. Issei becomes both an overblown moral hero who’s just as selfish and horny as the person he goes against.


There’s irony there. It flips the story where two people beat up each other because they disagree and somehow their strength proves their idea right. I wish the irony was more developed though. Issei knows he’d like to be that asshole he’s fighting, the guy with the harem. The anime doesn’t take a step back to laugh at this, at least not enough.


The problem is that it’s not enough to just know you’re making an ecchi series. You still need direction, you need to aim somewhere. What prevents the series from becoming really enjoyable is its lack of direction. Is this about how stupid but kind of cute we are in high school when hormones drive us crazy? Or is this about a hero that’s going to push himself over the edge for a girl because he’s hungry for sex?


If the series would’ve chosen to alternate between the two, it would’ve been fine. Instead, it jumps back and forth between the two. It only gets focused at the end, where it sticks to the epic fight and nothing else. At least it’s victorious there. The fight is well-animated and has a pretty enough scenery to make it exciting. The exaggeration of the characters is also believable enough to make the final conflict feel epic enough.


The fantasy element is one of the good parts. It’s a cute spin on the Devil/Angel dichotomy that doesn’t pretend to be profound. The idea of devils doing services for people is rife for potential comedy. They play around with it a little and then abandon it. The epic battle was fine, but it was more fun to see Issei trying to do things and being a loser. It’s an opportunity to create odd side-characters who can have their ideas summed up in one episode. There are more seasons and I hope they play around with this more.


Now comes the fatal part, where humiliation is passed off for sexiness. I don’t mind the camera finding its way to changing rooms or how clothes get ripped off during battles in sexy ways. What I don’t understand is, is it necessary to have the characters strip others naked against their will for our enjoyment? It’s not sexy and it’s not humorous.


High School DXD knows what it isn’t, but it also doesn’t know what it is. There is heart here. These people really wanted to make an anime that will capture the fun spirit Ecchi can have, but they didn’t know how. Maybe the next seasons have more focus. I hope so. Rias is too much of a fun character and Issei is a rare Harem protagonist who actually contributes to the story. It’s a fun show, but as crazy as it sounds I think we can do more with Ecchi.


2.5 devils out of 5

What do you get when you mix fan service and plot? High School DxD!
High School DxD is a twelve episode anime produced by studio TNK released in the winter of 2012. 
The anime revolves around high school student and grade A pervert Issei Hyodo. His goal is to become a harem king and after meeting with the crimson haired beauty Rias Gremory could his dreams come true. 
Story: 
Our main protagonist Issei is a pervert, an open one at that. He dreams of having an array of beautiful girls showering him with attention. After being asked out by a timid girl he soon learns ofthe existence of devils and angels. Upon finding this out the angel attacks him. He would later be healed and made to join Rias Gremory's group of subordinates. 


Now prior to my initial thoughts there actually seems to be some semblance of a story. Being a pawn in this scenario Issei is challenge to gather contracts from humans. (for whatever reason I've yet to establish) Issei then makes the goal of becoming a top rank devil which is very slow going. 


The general plot is somewhat overshadowed by the excessive fan service, however its thrown in mainly for parody reasons. High School DxD is a show that can be serious when it wants to be and it also doesn't stray from its comedic and stereotypical harem anime. This anime is not meant to be taken seriously. I can sum it up with it being a fun show to watch. 



Characters: 


Issei Hyodo is our main protagonist. It's abundantly clear from episode one that he is a pervert. He gets involved with friends on spying on the girls changing room. Despite this fact he has a good heart. He demonstrates this time and time again with all the female characters in the show. His shear will power to become the greatest demon is nothing abnormal from most main protagonists who are against the odds, but who knows. The only development I can see from Issei is that he gains a greater lever of power and maybe he'll pick a fucking girl to date! 


Rias Gremory is our main female protagonist and is the to be head of the Gremory household. She helps Issei out after his altercation with an angel and contracts him to serve the Gremory household. She is the standard set for Issei to beat in terms of power and in general a model demon. She like the many other females in this series wants his... Love? I suppose that'll do. 


Other characters include the shy and blond cutie that is Asia. Asia is a former nun renowned for her healing abilities, she is also my joint favourite female in the series. Akeno is the sexy and sadistic goddess of lightning who has definitely got my vote for the best female character along with Asia. Koneko who is the equivalent of many other Kuudere's and lastly Yuto Kiba who doesn't get much screen time until season two. 



Art: 

The art is standard. Nothing balls to walls worthy but its good during the battle scenes. Other TNK works I have watched include School days... How the hell did I forget that? 



Sound: 

The sound is god suits the theme of the show, but I've yet to listen to the OST on its own. 



Final Verdict:

High School DxD is an anime that isn't meant to be taken seriously. Its a bit of fun for male anime fans. If you are tired of shows with excessive fan service then you may want to stay clear. Mainly aimed at male audiences so girls you may wanna check out fruit basket instead. 


Overall I give High School DxD a 7 out of 10 


Alternate recommendations are High School of the dead, another show which contains excessive amounts of fan service, but with zombies! and another one of TNK's works which is School days... I'd just stick to the former if I were you guys. 


Thanks for reading guys, have a nice day!

Wow, just wow.  If you are not a fan of female nudity or so much sex references, then watch something else.  However, if you don't watching a show that might have been made for perverts, then you may enjoy this anime.
Story 6/10: To be fair this show does has a solid bases of a story.  It has its moments when it takes itself serious and it does have good action pack moments.  However, the anime knows that it isn't meant to be taken too serious and most of the time I just couldn't believe what was happen in it.  However,it is a real simple story as it is, just with a lot of female nudity.


Art 8/10: The art style of the show is actually decent.  It is set in a high school so everyone has to wear a similar uniform but they all do stand out.  Also it is a bit bright at times even when it is supposed to be about demons and other underworld themes, but that just meant be part of the whole "not taking itself to serious" thing.


Sound 7/10: The sound is also another element that is done well.  The background theme does tell what the main character, Issei, is feeling at most times.  Also the characters' VO does a great job here; you're able to tell what the characters are portraying at the time they are speaking.  The music and other sound doesn't really stand out that much but that might be because they reuse it for both the serious moments and the comedy bits in this show.


Character 7/10: There are a lot of characters here but the main one is Issei Hyoudou.  This maybe a spoiler but it is revealed in like the first five minutes of the first episode so am just going to say it.  Issei is one of the biggest perverts I have ever seen in any anime.  If there was a top 10 list somewhere, I believe he would be at least be ranked 2 or 3.  However, he does show growth throughout the show in a very good sense and he does have some good qualities to him.  The other characters on the other hand they really stay the same.  By the third episode you would get a pretty good idea about the other characters in the show and they don't even have as much growth as Issei, if any for that matter.  Even the new characters that come in late in the first season you are able to paint a pretty good picture of them even with just a few lines of dialogue.


Enjoyment 7/10: As I said this show doesn't take itself too serious throughout the show but that is part of its charm.  It just offers a good mild entertainment value with a simple story premise to follow.  There were even a few moments where I was laughing as to how stupid it was being, again that was part of its charm.


Overall 7/10: If you are able to get past all of the female nudity and the sex reference you may enjoy watching this anime.  It isn't the greatest anime but it most certainly isn't the worst thing put out.

Hi! Robert's Too Late Review coming down! Check the synopsis, minor spoilers possibly, and of note, I'm reviewing the dub version. This review is only of the first season, I will update and revise as I finish the final season of the series. Until then, this is dealing only with Season 1. First of all, yes, DxD has boobs. Fine, fine, DxD has a LOT of boobs. But there's more to be had here. Read on and see if this series warrants a spot on the vaunted wall! 
Story: 9
This anime is quite famous for the ecchi elements, and make no doubt, this show isabsolutely saturated in fanservicey nudity and innuendo. For that matter, it often goes beyond just innuendo and has characters outright proposition each other. While we never stray below the belt (or the panty-line, most commonly in this series) there are still quite a bit of overt, and mostly over-the-top sexuality. The thing about this is, however, we are served a storyline that is absolutely sound outside of all the fanservice. In fact, I believe that if one was to completely extract every last ounce of nudity from this anime, the supernatural plot would still leave this series highly rated. 


We have a story of devils and fallen angels, exorcists and errant nuns, powers and battles. There is an element of coming to terms with one's own inner weaknesses and even strengths as we watch the characters move through this supernatural tale. If you have any interest in mythological stories, tales dealing with otherworldly powers then there's a lot to like here. That is, if you can look past the silly nudity and perverted elements that pervade the anime. 


On the other hand, there is a great mistreatment of the female characters, which is odd, considering they comprise the majority of the cast. Rias, while the strong female lead, still is rather helpless without Issei, the male lead. Every woman seems to only be able to exist within the confines of their relationship with either Issei or another male character. Rias is presented as Issei's master, and a *very* high ranking devil, but still is almost subservient to his wants and desires. In the end, it's still about Issei rescuing Rias, not powerful Rias saving herself. This part of the story is troubling. Seeing this kind of thing is not uncommon, but is distressing regardless. I would love to have seen all these female characters, of which regarding the main cast are all *far* more powerful than our male lead Issei, acting in an empowered manner, and standing for themselves. By bringing the story constantly back to focus on how Issei is ultimately the deciding factor and the only important player with power, the story is weakened, which is sad because as I sad, we have a great foundation for a story of powerful devils and their activities. 


Regardless, the story still stands strong even in the face of this groan inducing downplay of feminine power. And yes, if you are here to see boobs, there are plenty to go around. There is also a strong comedy element attached to the ecchi material. As usual, the pervert's cliched behavior is played off as comedic relief. I will admit at times, it is actually funny. While I just made a long declaration about female positioning in this anime, the truth is that for a good part of it, Issei is a breast-obsessed idiot. Another trope in and of itself, a powerful, usually male, lead character having an inverse relationship between his power levels and his intelligence. One line from the dialog to highlight this: Issei actually says at one point: "I'm fine with being stupid!" Yeah. That's....informative. Overall, the story is about his growth, as he comes into his own powers, and in his love for Rias. He does make some movements of growth, but this is still very much a battle and boob fest. 


Still, even with the dings, the story of devil fights and awesome battles still very much interests me, and I'm excited to see each new layer of power, and each tidbit of lore related revelations.


Art: 9

Absolutely mind blowing, (no pun intended) the art on DxD is just staggeringly cool. And I'm not just referring to the 'jiggly orbs' as Issei might say. The battle powers are intense and cool, character and animation flow are superb. Whereas another anime might give you a solid, yet fairly simple animation of a person executing a power in a direct manner, DxD will have the camera spinning around the character, and especially if they are female (which they almost always are) the view will zoom up and down their bodies, giving the requisite panty shot, but also adding a layer of complexity to the entire animation. For example, a normal show might have 'arm up, arm forward, blast' where this anime will have 'arm up, spinning camera down to thigh level, quick panty shot before spinning all the way back to fingertips quickly then around and dow as the arm comes forward and then blast'. This attention to detail, albeit the ecchi details, gives the art a highly polished look. 


Sound: 8

in the dub version, the voices are amazing. I am a big Jamie Marchi fan, and this was my real first exposure to her talents working a lead role. She voices Rias with perfect weight and smoothness. I absolutely, totally LOVE Akeno's original voice actress, and because of her superior work Akeno is one of my favorite all time characters. Asia's voice is borderline annoying at times, but she sounds appropriately innocent which fits her character well. Koneko's voice is really cool and gives her the ability to play off her insults at Issei in a very comedic way, as one of the only girls not down for the whole 'let's be Issei's harem' idea. Even Kiba's voice is fitting for his form and style, so why only and 8 when I give all this praise? Well, I said I would limit this review to Season 1, but I think it's relevant to say, don't get too attached to Issei or Akeno's voices, as they do not make it to the end of the series. That alone is what troubles me about the sound in this anime. Otherwise I'm good, the battles are nice, the background music is well played, and the theme songs are fun. The only other ding really is the Sacred Gear itself and the need to say 'boost!' over and over, anime calling out powers before use is almost a requirement. 


Character: 8

Ah, the place this series shines the brightest, and fails the hardest. Interesting dichotomy, huh? I've gotten into this a bit in the story section, but I will reiterate that the females all seem to be about falling over themselves for Issei's attention, and not standing upright on their own. Yet, they are in fact powerful characters, and this isn't completely hidden behind the 'does he love me?' wall. Rias throws down when needed, and early on before the romance subplot weakens her, she's fairly firm at times with Issei. Akeno is ass-kicking wrapped in traditional miko garb, and is very sexually excited by inflicting pain on others. Asia however immediately falls into the rut of needing Issei's approval for everything. This is tempered by the fact he is responsible for bringing her into the devil family to begin with, so it's not completely unwarranted. 


The support cast of Koneko and Kiba are interesting characters as they are not involved in crushing on Issei. Koneko considered Issei a pervert of the highest order (he is) and Kiba is male, and either straight, or Issei is not his type whatsoever. This does lend a little balance, but they do kind of take a back seat to the Issei love fest. Issei is, of course, a bit of an idiot as I've said, but as he gains power, he loses some of his foolish ways. But make no mistake, even by the end of the season he's still flipping out over naked breasts and the idea of sex with any number of the female cast. 


Basically we have a male that starts out stereotypical that slowly gains a tiny bit of brainpower coupled with strong females that quickly lose their self reliance as they become attracted to Issei. Therein we have great characters at the same time as ones that fail. While it's fine to have Rias impressed with Issei when he fights for her sake, with honest feeling in his heart for her, its still overdone that she's basically putty in his hands when she's supposed to be the next ruler of the Underworld and he's just a reincarnated human that she herself brought back. I love the characters (especially Akeno) but yet at the same time despair over how they all lose their minds as Issei grows in power. 


Enjoyment: 9

Despite the glaring flaws, this anime is still an utter blast to watch. The pacing is well done, and the overall plot is interesting. I love the whole devil angle that's played. I wish they did a little less on the fanservice, and have hopes that we see that element downplayed as the series pushes on in seasons. I would love to show the overall story to people like my niece who is coming to age, but the saturation of breasts and clothes being ripped off makes what otherwise might be something she really enjoyed inappropriate for her. Its hard to discuss this anime with some people because they hear DxD and instantly think 'pervert alert'. No one wants to credit the story, the animation, the awesome battles with the praise they deserve because the main character had to go and make one of his powers the ability to remove all a girls' clothes with a thought. If they swung around less boobs in the show, I think it would likely be even more popular because there are many that don't appreciate the juvenile nature of the ecchi content. I say the other elements far outweigh the embarrassment and droll ecchi elements and deserve a serious watch, serious consideration. 


Just know you're going to have to slog through a good deal of drooling, nude girls, and enough adjectives for breasts to fill a dictionary before you go in. Final verdict? Great, if you can get past the breasts (or enjoy them if you wish, who am I to mind?) and finally Akeno herself ranked two pictures on the wall. (because she's super awesome, clearly) Until next time, my friends!

Ecchi. Harem. Fanservice. Highchool DxD falls into these categories of shows that Funimation loves to scoop up so they can sell replacement soft core pornography on Xbox Live for 13 year olds who have their parent’s credit. These T&A focused shows are the bane of most advocates of artistic anime out there since they tend to be the anime punching bag for most conservative straight arrows who like to ridicule anything different by using its most provocative qualities. While most shows of this type try their best to hide their sex filled fantasies with some simple action, convoluted  plot devices, and dry humor; DxDcomes out a step above the rest by being both undeniably drenched in sexiness and a fun and un-embarrassing watch.


Issei is an ordinary high school boy who has only one thing on his mind: sex. Actually it is more that he is really into boobs because he is so juvenile and innocent that I am not sure he would even know what to do with a girl if he got one. After suddenly being asked out on a date by one his classmates, he is one step closer to making his dreams of having a girlfriend come true. That is until she turns out to be a demon, puts a spear through his heart, and leaves him to die; you know the typical first date stuff. His life is soon saved by a beautiful red haired girl from his school who is another demon from a rival faction. An heir to the devil’s thrown actually, and he soon becomes a part of her court of chess pieces (or lesser devils) and now must use his life, as well as a great power only he possesses, to carry out the whims off his new master… and blah blah blah we get it… this a fantasy light novel adaptation, the formula hasn’t changed much since Shakugan no Shana.


Story wise DxD does falls into a great number of genre convictions that have been well treed territory by similar fare for the past decade. But what makes this show work is that it raises a step above the rest in both its shonen style action and slice of life humor while not being afraid to take itself less serious. The story is easy to follow while keeping with these genre trappings and even offers an interesting and vaguely original concept in the way it uses its devils vs angels motif. The devils being the good guys (or at least the faction we follow) is a weird divergent from how most of stories handle this rivalry. This is echoed by a chorus of new to the group characters (including a once devout nun of the church) who find out that god doesn’t really care for devils that much; a concept that is established through a running gag of praying to god leading to a horrible headache in return. The show recycles many running gags other shows of the genre have done, but always in innovative and funny ways, even Issei’s typical male mc “Baka! Ecchi!” moments of running into girls in provocative situations are less infuriating and mind numbing than other series. The humor stays consistent and genuinely funny as tasks to fulfil mortal wishes to gain a contract of the person’s soul (another play on the devils motif) turn into hilarious and bizarre misadventures, and a battle with a dreaded tentacle monster is less of a commentary and more a bizarre parody or homage to an old established trope.


The character archetypes run the gambit from sweet masochist, clumsy moe bait, and bishonen hottie, but also have a few refreshing takes. Mainly Rias Gremory who ventures out of tsundere territory, and her noble aristocrat manner of behaving makes her an actually compelling love interest as her character develops through the series. Some characters achieve more development while the side characters with less screen time back up events just enough to be notable additions and are set up well enough to have interesting arches in the second season. While the show goes great to lengths to treat its primarily strong female cast with respect, it does fall victim to the male power fantasy “got to save the princess” trope near the end of the first season. It at least does not dive into complete misogyny like other series that have done the same plotline such as Sword Art Online. It is funny that a show that gets off on female nudity handles female characters better than a popular show like SAO that tries to hide its hideous portrayal of gender roles.

The ecchi genre is by far one of the more popular genres of anime today. The top anime of many streaming services like Netflix tend to have these shows in the top spot, while companies like Funimation and Sentai spend a good deal of marketing on them. While the genre can be over-run with weak and embarrassing shows, Highschool DxD finishes a step above the rest and is must watch for anyone interested.

If you've made it this fair and are now reading my review, then by now you've realized this is an ecchi/harem, and a rather revealing one at that.  I hardly think that's an issue with those of you who are interested in a good harem, and for those who came here expecting a deeply interwoven dramatic plot, it might be best to now consider what you're working with here.  Nevertheless this is by far the most entertained I've been regarding any series in a little while and here's why...(The following review will contain no spoilers)
Story 6/10-  The story isn't the reason whyyou're going to be interested in High-school DxD, plain and simple.  However it certainly hold enough plot to actually make you wonder about certain things other than the obvious and enjoyable fan-service. Early on the main character Hyoudou Issei, a typical perverted highschooler is thrown into a not so typical situation.  The supernatural elements are very prevalent in this story and it's actually pretty interesting for what it is.  Highschool DxD does a good enough job laying a foundation where the characters can grow within, and not making it the most ridiculous thing you've ever seen.


Art 7/10-  The art is good overall, nothing really to complain about but it won't amaze you in any profound way.  All of the characters however are all very well designed, they all have some conventional traits from the usual archetypes presented in anime.  That said though, they all have unique quirks and curves or lack thereof(I'm sorry I had to) that make them all very distinguishable from one another.  Aside from the crisp character designs, the different settings they find themselves in are also nicely presented and you aren't stuck within a club-room or classroom like some Harem so often choose to do.  


Sound 6/10-  The sounds isn't anything to write home about.  Much like the story, and there really isn't much to say about it other than it has have a good OP and the rare fitting score in the background from time to time.


Character 8/10-  Other than enjoying the series itself, this is by far the best and most important part of the entire anime.  Every single girl in the harem is noticeably different and aren't fawning over left, right and center for the guy.  They all have unique powers and traits as well that interests you, and actually wants to see how strong they are.  All of this is just gravy on top of how well the characters are voiced.  I would normally put this part in the "sound" section but the seiyuu add so so much to the characters, it would be better mentioned here.  They're all very fitting voices and provide distinct personality to every one of them.  You just know it's a good harem when the characters are this well developed and presented when many other in the same genre tend to "cheat" and skip ahead.  On top of that, the main character Hyoudou Issei is a great male lead.  He's never whining or beating himself up over nothing.  He will sometimes make a crack about how he hasn't done something, but nothing that will make you want to slap him silly.  He also progresses nicely along with the others and quickly proves he has a strong place in the show.


Enjoyment 9/10-  My favorite part of the review of course.  This is my favorite harem I have ever watched for many of the reasons stated above and then some.  I felt interested and invested in the characters and actually cared enough about the story arcs to be able to watch multiple episodes consecutively.  Usually I find this difficult with a Harem genre since most don't have too much else drawing you in.  This show has plenty of romance and it actually builds nicely rather than have all these beautiful girls just smitten with love right off the bat.  Look at it this way, while he's surrounded by these beautiful women, he's only given an opportunity and still has to work very hard for their affection and love.  Plainly put, I very much enjoyed this anime and will be re-watching it in the future when it leaves my recent memory.


Overall 8/10-  I highly recommend this to anyone remotely interested in the harem/ecchi genre.  The ecchi is very open but somehow does feel rightly placed because that's not all there is to it.  There's a nice developing romance(s) going on, the characters are actually very interesting and easy to root for as well.  For those who are thinking about watching their first Harem/ecchi this would be the one to start with.

High School DxD is an anime in which you either have a deep hatred of it or you love High School DxD for how it compliments the ecchi genre so well...
This review will cover on why i personally think DxD is or is one of the greatest ecchi harem's ever...
STORY
High School DxD revolves around our main protagonist; Issei Hyoudou who is a pretty generic horny pervert that dreams of having his very own harem one day. He ends up being killed by a fallen angel and falls under Rias Gremory's Occult Research Club. HOWEVER, High School DxD is possibly one of if not the ONLYecchi harem anime to actually use the fanservice to develop the plot and also gives Issei a driving force to defeat enemies. Although the writers were smart enough to make Issei have hardly any pure power or op strengths in the beginning as this allows for character development to take place. Issei and the gang each have their own unique and sometimes even funny personalities which allow more interesting and less generic boring scenes to take place.


ART


The art style in High School DxD was unique due to the fact that it had an older sort of style to it. While others see this is 'terrible and looks awful' I'd say that the style really complements the character's designs and attributes. Having more of a new art style would make DxD appear as more of a childish moe styled anime while in fact it's actually quite mature.


SOUND


The audio quality in DxD was as usual from Madman, very high quality. The fighting sounds were on point and they even had the dub cast spot on with the anime. DxD actually ends up on the good side of dubs. The OST is also very high quality with most of the background music during fights and such fitting perfectly into the feel of DxD


SUMMARY


All in all, I would recommend DxD due to the facts that it's overall a very stable anime even though it has some generic scenes filled into it. It's 56th most popular anime on MAL, this might be due to the fanservice or other's recommending it to their peers. The storyline is amazing due to the fact the writers use the fan-service to their advantage in developing the plot.

A lot of people in the anime community usually look down on the "Ecchi + harem" genre, by saying its cheesy, often leads to a very unsatisfying ending or is just bad in general. But that might not be the case with this anime. Originally a Light Novel series by Ichiei Ishibumi and later adapted as an anime by TNK, Highschool DxD.
~STORY 9/10
Hyoudou Issei is a typical teenage boy, thinking about nothing but breasts and "ecchi stuff". If you count out his two best friends, he is basically a loner. He has always wanted a girlfriend, and this one day, his wish comes true. Abeautiful young girl meets him on his way home from school, and asks him out. 

He plans this date very well, and on the day it goes accordingly, he thought.. It appears she had plans of her own, when she brutally stabs him in the city park. She then reveals herself to be a vicious fallen angel who planned to kill Issei to get rid of his sacred gear, also know as Gods Artifacts. These are items with powerful abilities that are given to humans when they're born. Issei feels his life slipping away, and his consciousness fades. He then wakes up in his bed at home, alongside the most beautiful student in his school, the crimson haired Rias Gremory. She tells him that he died, but was reincarnated by her as a devil, and she is now his master.


"My name is Rias Gremory. I am a Devil. And I am your Master. Nice to meet you, Hyoudou Issei-kun. Can I call you Ise?" (Volume 1, Life 1)


Alright, this anime. I love it. The popular saying "came for the *plot*, stayed for the plot" works both ways in this case. I really like the story, and most other ecchi harem stories get blown out of the water. After watching DxD I've seen some other ecchi harem anime, and oh my god. It made me realize that DxD is actually the best ecchi harem I've seen. Most of the characters are interesting and fun. The plot keeps a good pace, and tells a surprising amount of story, considering most people see DxD as 12 episodes of jiggling boobies and sexual innuendos.


~CHARACTERS 8/10


Ah yes, the characters. I loved the characters for the most part. I decided to only cover the absolute main characters, since they're the ones you see the most.


Rias Gremory - She starts of as a "normal" highschool girl, but at the same time, she is the most popular student, and the most beautiful girl in school. She is revealed to be aDevil. A high-class devil in fact, and is currently gathering peerage members/servants. This makes her a [king]. This is explained later in the season. Rias is shown as a very caring and protective person. She treats her group more like family rather then to boss them around. I really liked this aspect, and it shows that a master/leader dosent have to be bossy. She's also got to be one of the characters with the most development, mostly towards Ise, but also the other group members.


Hyoudou Issei - The main character, a pretty generic harem MC, or that's atleast what he looks like. Ise was different then most harem MC's in my opinion. Of course, he messes up most of the possible ecchi moments with the girls. He is killed by a fallen angel, and reincarnated by Rias and is now a [Pawn] piece in her peerage. Ise is born with a Boosted Gear, a unique sacred gear with the spirit of a dragon.


Other important characters include the sadistic and seductive Akeno, the violent first-year loli Koneko, Kiba the womanizer, and a whole lot more.


~ART/ANIMATION 9/10


Some people may say the DxD art is pretty bad, and its not my favorite art either, but its not as bad as people want it to be. I think this style fit the show great, and shouldn't really go trough any changes. And when it comes to the animation, I think its very good, and its a pretty huge plus for me. Ofcourse, It probably wont ever match itself with some of the anime made by bigger studios like Kyoto Animation, Bones or Madhouse Studios, I think TNK did a pretty good job to work out some great animation. 


~MUSIC/SOUND 9/10


The soundeffects for DxD are just great. Everything is just so well thought-out and fits so well. And the soundtrack is just fantastic. It varies from the peaceful songs during calm dialog scenes, to powerful and dramatic music for fights and serious events.

The opening and ending songs thematically fit the series very well, and maintains the quality of the series. In the release of the Original Highschool DxD Soundtrack, a GS! Version of STUDY x STUDY was released. It's the same song, but now the characters voice actors does the vocals instead.

What you’ll hear from many people is that the story/plot from most ecchi anime are not very good or well put together, and focus more on the ecchi aspect. I think that statement is proven wrong by the great storyline that develops through this season. The plot slowly picks up the pace and builds up character development quite well until you're matched with some great action scenes. The well thought out dialogue and setting truly do the plot justice, and might I add, it’s well deserved. Personally, I feel they did a great job on balancing the key aspects like the ecchi, with thestory aspect. I have to admit though, there are some points where you may feel like the story is moving along slowly,  but it'll make up it. It can surely put you in a spot where you are asking for more and wondering what will happen next. 


Characters 8/10


I thought the characters were a nice addition to the anime. Its nice when you have very different and unique characters that maybe you can relate to in some way. There are, ofcourse the cliches when it comes to ecchi anime but that's too be expected. The main protagonist, Issei Hyoudou, your average highschool boy in love with oppai and perverted as ever. Although there is a nice twist on things, instead, his powers work off of his pervertedness and you can see them slowly improve through time. Rias Gremory, another high school student, also known as the most beautiful girl at the school. Has a nice and unique background that can keep you intrigued, not only are her devil powers interesting, but she also has great oppai ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°). Other characters are also unique, like Akeno Himejima, the lighting using sadistic queen. As Well as Koneko for all you Loli’s out there. Also Kiba who is quite interesting once you get to learn more about him and see his unique power and fighting. 


Sound 9/10


In my opinion, The sound is one of the best parts of this anime. The background music always fits the scene well and are pleasing to the ear. Dramatic scenes are definitely enhanced by the strategically placed background music that can be very strong and powerful. Peaceful scenes accompanied with the music can also help to set the atmosphere.The Voice Actors are nice, they are also fitting to each character, no complaints here. I feel if I was to have read the Light Novels first I would have imagined there voices just as they are. Now for my favourite part, The OP and ED! The Opening, Trip - Innocent of D is always great to listen to, although that's most likely because I’m a sucker for electric guitar. The Ending, STUDY X STUDY is also another great addition. Usually I would skip ED’s but I actually really enjoyed this one, it fits well with the anime.

Enjoyment - 9

Overall - 9 

Overall you have a decent solid story line which provided a good framework to really push on and develop both the characters and the next few story arcs. Visually very appealing with a soundtrack that is well suited and well used, coupled with some great voice performances  and a flair of originality rarely seen in high school harem animes. Now that the show has ended, here is my take on the series:
For those that care, it is  a very ecchi Harem series and your standard "Fighting makes girls lose all their clothes" anime. I generally like fighting anime and feel an amused indifference to ecchi, but if you really liked any of the following anime, you'll probably really like High School DxD:
Ikkitousen, Freezing, Ichiban Ushiro no Daimaou, Queen's Blade, or Sekirei

There area lot of chess references as well, enough in fact that they become integral to the plot as lesser demons (Pieces) are enslaved to their master (King).


The art is very good and the series has one of the more interesting ending credits you'll ever see. Characters are stereotypical Moe, but in no way are any of them badly done.


Overall, is a decent anime. If you love Nudity and Girls Fighting anime, this is a must watch. If that type of anime offends you, skip it. Otherwise, it is a decent anime that you may not watch over and over, but at least you won't regret seeing it.

Okay, I'll be honest with you guys: I LOVE High School DxD.  Doesn't mean that I'll let it off when it come to ratings.
If this is a little too much to read, I recommend just reading my "Enjoyment" and "Overall" sections.  That basically summarizes the anime without getting into any finer detail.
To start off, this show is...GREEAATTerr...maybe?  It isn't...oh...why isn't it good?  Jokes aside, this anime suffers a LOT when you think about it.  The story is a "6" and I'm being GENEROUS.  As a fan, I know I might be biased, but I'm going to try my bestto be fair (and so, this review was biased).


Story: 6 - Decent (Fair according to MAL)


Well, better than Hagure Yuusha that's for sure.  This actually has a story!  The story is split into two "arcs".  One arc taken from one Light Novel volume.  The first 6 episodes are from the 1st Volume, the next 6 episodes are from the 2nd volume.  They aren't great, but they aren't bad either.  It's decent.  Nothing too special.  It'll entertain you for the next 3-4 hours but don't expect anything too extraordinary.  Just lots...and lots...of obscure jokes about female mammary glands.  Don't say I didn't warn you.


Art: 7 - Actually pretty diverse (Good according to MAL)


Its set pieces are diverse, that's for sure.  They're well drawn and painted and fits the theme of the anime well.  They aren't too unique though since some are basically just night time pieces with purple skies.  The animation remains consistent too.  And I mean that in a very literal sense, Rias's PLOT bounces in like...EVERY scene.  Jokes aside, the art and animation are solid here.  There is no drop in quality and all animation is consistent.  Character designs are solid too, nothing special, but they are copying from a Light Novel's illustrations.  However, one thing to point out though: You'll basically always see them in their school uniforms.  Basically.


Sound: 9 - Very fitting (Great according to MAL)


I don't have to say much.  The track fits the show very, very well.  I don't have to say much.  Each piece has a purpose and it just works.  The opening and ending are...actually pretty unique, MUSIC wise.  They aren't the same as other anime openings and endings and that's all I'll say.  The ending is pretty hilarious though.  I kinda got addicted to it when I watched it the first time...you'll see why.


Character: 5 - HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA...what?  (Mediocre according to MAL)


Okay, first to say this: NOBODY MATTERS BESIDES ISSEI, RIAS AND ASIA.  Everyone remains the EXACT SAME besides those three.  Issei gets the least character development, though you could argue with Asia.  Rias has a bit more character development but nothing too...substantial.  Again, same problem with 99% of anime: STOCK CHARACTERS.


You have the dandere tsundere, the sadist, the noble knight, the pervert (our MC), the innocent girl that doesn't know common sense (for now...) and the really, really hot girl that everyone looks up to like a sister and secretly wants to bang...more of Issei on that last bit though.  Their characters remain practically the same throughout the story.  Issei's character changes drastically when we're talking about emotion though, somewhat annoying since he overreacts to the smallest things.  I won't get into anyone else because NOBODY CHANGES.  They're all practically flat characters.  Asia is either happy, sad or shocked.  Rias is always calm and collected with one exception.  Kiba is forever the noble knight.  Koneko, the dandere tsundere.  No comment there.  And Akeno, the super sadist, arguably kuudere.  That's it.  They're all flat and surprisingly ISSEI is the ONLY ROUND CHARACTER in this season...SEASON (gets better in later seasons).


Enjoyment: 10 - I see BOOBS I press like (Outstanding according to MAL)


Jokes aside, this is very polar.  On one side, people will LOVE the series for what it is.  On the other side, people will not understand anything and will hate the series.  I'll explain it from a fan's point of view (or mine in this case).


Universe building, character interaction and story.


Now, I know what you're thinking "Sonic, you said the story was sh*t!"


No, I didn't say the story was shit, I just said that it was average.  But an average story with a good universe is still enticing.  The story is SIMPLE.  Not much thought is needed.  It's not complicated at all.  The universe however is very interesting.  It was interesting enough for me to pick up reading the Light Novels.  They do show you a good portion of the universe here and it keeps on getting more and more interesting.  This show doesn't have THREE seasons for no reason (please god, let there be a fourth).


Now, the concept of "Devils and Angels" doesn't really sound anything special, but this guy, the author, he just takes it and ROLLS with it.  He builds up a solid universe with in depth explanations and everything.  Heck, he turned his first Light Novel (Slash Dog) into a PREQUEL to DxD.  The concepts and ideas that he uses is very, very interesting.  However, they may seem insignificant because of all the breast jokes and fan service, but after some thought they're actually very solid concepts.  I do have a problem with the fanservice, but I'll get to that after this one.


Character interaction.  This is probably the only reason I watch ecchi-harem shows and the same reason for a good portion of you guys too.  The interaction is great.  Exactly as what you'd expect and more.  Though it won't save me from the rant that's coming up in the next paragraph.  It's very solid, that's all I'll say.  It holds up.


Now.  My rant.  FAN SERVICE.  They SHOVE it into your face.  There's fan service in virtually every scene.  I'm not kidding.  If it's not panty shots then it's boob bounces/gainax bounce.  If not that, then it's probably a strip scene!  If you're watching the uncensored version, lock your doors and put on some head phones because you're going to hear moaning, see bare breasts and some other form of perverse fan service  in virtually every episode, EXCEPT the last one.  Thank god for that.  This is actually why so many people hate the show.  They LOVE to shove it right down your mouth.  This is practically fan service incarnate.  Now, there's obviously worse out there now, but for its time, High School DxD is the MOST ecchi anime ever created.  And it does NOT give the show any good favors.  Oh, and remember that "9" I gave it for sound?  They have BOOB SOUND EFFECTS.


Oh god.


Now, if they toned it down some and only kept "intense" scenes so the feel of the anime isn't ruined, then it would fix the problem IMMEDIATELY.  But their constant use of fan service in practically every shot really does get...redundant.  Even if I liked it sometimes.


Overall: 8 - Recommended for a try (Very Good according to MAL)


This may not be your show.  Like I said, it's a  polar choice.  You like it or you hate it.  I'm on the "like" side, though I obviously have some qualms about it.  Give it a try.  It's your choice.  Like it for the universe, hate it for its fan service.  It doesn't try to be anything it isn't, it plays the ecchi harem comedy genre straight.  If you know what you're getting into and like this kind of stuff, it's definitely your show.

This series is surprisingly decent in spite of its entry into the ecchi genre. While having the typical elements of ecchi like our perverted male lead Issei and a good amount of fan service and perverted content rear their head, High School DxD is smart enough not to use it to cover up a flimsy plot as this baby offers a good amount of exploration into its world and devoting focus on a number of characters among Rias and her servants among the Gremory family. Issei mixes around personality traits of a pervert and the hot-blooded main lead found within shounen battle anime. While helusts for and peeps on girls, he doesn't act on his impulses and cares for the well-being of the girls he interacts with among the Gremory residence enough where he puts himself at risk to protect them. These traits are nothing new for an anime with Issei, but the series strikes a balance with these aspects to his personality so neither one gets too overbearing and obnoxious with the worst sides of these common character types.


Outside of Issei, many of the characters in High School DxD within the series follow typical archetypes found within high school and action-type anime. Some of the characters do get some fleshing out with how they've been affected by the supernatural elements within the series such as Rias' family status with devils and Asia's equal acceptance of all types of beings making her face prejudice by those among her church. Otherwise, the majority of the cast are mostly underdeveloped and exist to fulfill the tropes they personify from high school and action-based anime, counting the irredeemable cocky and scumbag antagonists that the series introduces to create conflict in a couple arcs of the series.


The world exploration within the series serves to explore differing elements to the supernatural world of High School DxD. Outside of devils, the series introduces a number of other magical abilities and supernatural creatures that include familiars, magical teleportation, fallen angels and dragons. Elements to being a devil within the series are decently fleshed out such as how servants are created, their weaknesses and the influence of higher families within the devil world are explored.


The action element to the series dabbles a bit into shounen territory with how it is handled. Many of the abilities used by the characters in the series are nothing new that has been seen in anime such as Issei's Boosted Gear looking like a knockoff of Kazuma's Shell Bullet power from s-CRY-ed and Yuto's use of a ridiculous number of swords for battle being like what Archer and Gilgamesh utilize from Fate/stay night. Also, the typical tropes of said genre such as the male lead getting a power boost in the heat of battle and refusing to give up in spite of overwhelming odds, as well as a battle game style match being utilized in a later episode. In spite of these issues, the fights are decently animated and the animators do well at covering up any shortcuts they may have utilized to get what they needed out of action scenes.


Overall, High School DxD is a surprisingly decent offering for the ecchi genre as it mixes supernatural lore and action with its storytelling while offering the typical perverted antics of ecchi. It doesn't break any new ground and I wouldn't recommend this to those who detest the ecchi genre and/or shounen battle titles. But if you don't mind a series that dabbles into both elements without going too far in depicting them, then High School DxD may be for you.

A lot of people tend to categorize High School DxD as the over the top ecchi/ harem anime that simply wasted all of its budget on animating the tits of the female characters, however I think that as anime watchers we should stop stereotyping and remove the facade that we have placed upon animes in the genre and come to accept the true dignity and beauty of anime's such as High School DxD. The human passion of lust and women is translated into Issei as he attempts to reach his life goal of "becoming the harem king" and this triggers a series of character developmentas well as a surprisingly good plot for a ecchi anime, with of course abundant boob action that you will see for like 30% of every episode. If nudity or tits just aren't your cup of tea, then i suggest that you stop reading  and drop the series because trust me this anime consists of soft core porn left,right and center.


Now this well be extremely surprising but this anime has QUITE A GOOD STORY-LINE. Yes you are probably thinking wtf am i saying however after watching a tonne of anime's in the same genre i can assure you that that the storyline that High School DxD conjures is far superior  to the likes of Date A Live and Trinity Seven. There is simply a lot more depth within the story as everything happens for a specific purpose and i found the presentation of these events were done extremely well with good pacing and context. In DxD we follow a high school boy and his two horny friends who show their love for boobs and girls just like typical pubescent boys at that age. However ironically Issei's love for girls is what gets him killed on his first date and he is then resurrected by demon princess Rias Gremory, hence exposing Issei to the world of Demons and Angels. From here we see Issei mature as a devil and contribute abundantly to the plot of High School DxD through both his boosted gear and his perverted conceptions which simply balance out a the storyline with intense and emotional battles and events as well a good serving of fan-service that we all love.  However many do also question the originality of such a series  and here is where i can to prove to you that Dxd is second to none. High School DxD is the predecessor of all other harem animes within the 21st century with animes such as Dakara boku wa H ga Dekinai and Shinmai Maou no testament, using the concept of DxD in their series.Plus  the light novels were released way before most other Harem series so you can bank on its originality. Overall i found the storyline to be a solid 9/10


The Character Development in High School DxD is also on point as you see Issei mature from being a perverted teenager who got hit hard by puberty, to a hardworking and headstrong character. All the characters are versatile and served some purpose towards the storyline, For starters we have the exquisite President Rias Gremory whose traits are reflected in Issei through the close bond that they share. Moving on we have the sadistic Akeno and the cute loli- neko character of Koneko, both of whom have strong personalities and are simply aesthetic to the series itself. Then we have Asia who brings the aspect of innocence into DxD through her caring and soft personality which contributes so much to the character development of the other members and Issei. Finally we have Kiba who is the other male member of club that is a complete opposite to Issei in both personality and mentality and his character brings about the sense of normality within series. So in the midst of all the big boobs and nosebleeds i saw the characters all fitting perfectly into the plot of DxD as they each serve a different purpose (made through the analogy of chess pieces) and are extremely likeable from the get go. Perfect 10 in my opinion


The Art department was quite mediocre, yeah the character designs were quite good and "appealing" but they were too generic and the animation was quite average as well. However plus points awarded to sound as both the Opening and Ending theme songs are quite catchy even though I'm sure,  some people would consider it JRock trash. The soundtracks used also matched the scenes accordingly, especially at the intermission where they show you two juicy frames of quality fan service accompanied with a nice jingle that would generate raging hard on's. So overall I would give the Art a 7/10 and the sound a 9/10


Now in terms on enjoyment, High School DxD is practically the best ecchi/haremi anime i have seen, almost everything about this anime  kept my attention, from the big jiggling boobs to the intense fight scenes and of course the incessant comedy that Issei is able generate from almost everything he does. Yet despite all these external elements you can still enjoy a good storyline that is easy to follow and comprehend in High School DxD as well as make a connection to all the different characters and understand them as viewers. This was also the 3rd anime i ever watched so it has quite some nostalgic value as well. Easily earns a 10 from me


Overall i am willing to defy the views of all haters who think DxD is a pile of shit in the ecchi department and say that it is one of the best instead, hence the overall score i gave it being a 10. I enjoyed the series alot and have also watched season 2 and 3 which are as equally as good. I recommend this to anyone who can tolerate ecchi, because trust me you are missing out on truly one of the best series in the genre,

High School DXD is an ecchi/harem icon. If you are a fan of good storytelling punctuated with fanservice then DXD is for you. Some opinions fault DXD for being non-canonical with the manga or having too little story. The ecchi/harem tag can definitely create this illusion of a lack of storytelling, and sometimes critics are correct. However, DXD does an extremely good job at finding the right combination of content and fanservice making DXD very special. DXD found a way to advance its story in every episode instead of using filler episodes like most ecchis. It's also important to remember that an anime is ananime, and not a manga. STORY - 5
ART - 6
SOUND - 7
CHARACTER - 6
ENJOYMENT - 6
High School DxD qualifies as one of those anime that could be analogical to an attention-seeker. But kind of in a good and bad way. Eroticism fed through an occult world of demons and angels, that's a formula to garner people seeking to experience some spellbinding hormonal action.
There's no denying that DxD is an ecchi harem with the implementation of a story. Rather than just drawing interest with fan service, it mingled around with some interesting concepts that had their own generic charms. Frankly speaking, the religious and noble aspects only blanketed what became amediocre plot with a solid foundation but a weak structure. And the fact this show seemed to take its story seriously befell its true potential. No, I really can't turn my brain off or whatever as the show kept on trying to be impactful with its unfolding events. Honestly, the lackluster execution and the contrived reasonings with dull build-ups failed to evoke emotions in some of the more sentimental or badass scenes. It didn't helped that any tension quickly wavered in fights, especially with the bland motives of the antagonists who just spew out clichéd one-liners in the areas of "Masaka!". So really, the meat of the content was too undercooked but at least the surface was pretty crisp. While that progression failed, the characterization managed to succeed in place of it. In the Occult Research Club, the characters there all had their own interesting traits. A perverted boy goes through quite a bit of change through his relationships with other characters. Even when he has a really strong power, the fact he needed to train himself to use it and his willingness to do so left behind a kind-hearted value to his personality. Another great trait was the blending of ecchi with action, with his perversion serving as quite a leading role in breaking barriers. \n\n
The whole art looked pretty average other than for a couple of quirky appeals. There was this lingering fantasy lighting that filled up many of the scenes. Orange and red washouts from candles and magical powers, it's an extra something to be immersed with a churchly feel. Character designs also fitted the fantasy setting although the oversized breast sizes didn't really suit my taste, but that's a subjective thing and I'm sure a lot of ecchi fans liked it for the attention-grabbing nature that they possessed. Other than the fact that the animation was heightened up in action along with ecchi scenes, having empowering jiggling physics or bombardment of powers from the magics, it generally was nothing special with a blocky kind of movement going on. There were a lot of provoking angles that spiced up the fan service aspect that all ecchi must have. In the sound sector, each characters maintained their personality well with their voices, although it may have gotten a bit too melodramatic in the later episodes. A collection of good soundtracks gets the fight going with the dramatic and orchestral undertones to highlight the action. Also, the reverberating vibes of the "Boost!" that goes on whenever the perverted boy was using his power was another appealing thing. Might be random but I loved the echoing feel of it as it sent this pulsing shockwaves that goes through my whole body.\n\n
At the end, the potential is there, definitely. It's only the first season but High School DxD has its world set in stone and the history is briefly seen. Now, if only the execution can be improved on, it will become a sexy anime in all of its aspects.

Before I get into this video I just wanna say that a couple month’s ago Mother’s Basement made a fantastic video on YouTube as to why Highschool DxD has such a huge fanbase and is so damn marketable. I highly recommend that you watch his video before reading this review becuase it's a great video but also because I don’t plan on repeating everything he said word for word.  The only times I’ll echo what he said in his video is if it’s directly related to why I love this show, because that’s what this video is going to be about.  With thenew season currently airing, I figured it’d be an ample time to make a video about this wonderful show, and this might be long because there’s lots of reasons why I find this anime appealing.  The most obvious reason is the fanservice, and I’m sure that most people, once reading the title of this video, have already typed that in the comments, however I think it’s incredibly ignorant to suggest that this is the ONLY reason the show is good.  


Yes, the fanservice is amazing, it’s arguably my favorite fanservice anime.  Every girl in the entire show are incredibly cute and/or sexy, and considering that they have varying character designs and personalities, the show is able to easily appeal to many different kinds of fetishes.  Similar to Monster Musume, but not exactly the same, because that show appeals to fetishes primarily because it utilizes monster girls.  However, the boobs and the different fetishes in the show, as Mother’s Basement already discussed in his video, is part of the marketing of the show, and while I’d be lying if I said that it isn’t a big reason as to why I enjoy the show, it’s not the entire reason.  While a promise of bobs would get people to watch the show, if the story and characters weren’t good, then people would largely forget about it after it finished airing, which clearly hasn’t happened due to the light novels still being ongoing and the anime adaptation being on it’s fourth season now without any signs of loosing steam, and even spawned a blatant, crappier knockoff which began serialization the same year that the first season of the anime began.  


The standard Love Hina, Negima, Nisekoi, or Monster Musume harem anime doesn’t really have much of a shelf life past one, or maybe two seasons if it’s really good.  The female characters in Highschool DxD, despite obviously being drawn for the purpose of making guys horny, are likable and interesting, more so than a series like this probably required.  Rias Gremory is my personal favorite, and I think I’ve found that most people feel the same way.  When I first started watching the show I thought she’d be the token Tsundere, but she actually isn’t.  She does have a hard exterior and slowly warms up to the main character over the course of the show, but she isn’t a complete bitch who beats the shit out of him for no reason whatsoever.  And the thing is, unlike in most harem anime, she would have a perfectly good reason for wanting to beat Issei to a pulp because he actually is an extremely perverted character, unlike most harem leads who are generally good guys and just accidentally walk into compromising situations, and the girls beat them up based on misunderstandings.  Don’t get me wrong, Issei does get his ass handed to him by a lot of the girls in the show, but Rias is almost never one of them.  


Akeno Himejima is good if you’re into overly pushy dominatrix's, and both Asia and Koneko are good if you’re into lollies.  Also, Asia fits the nun fetish, which yes, believe it or not, that is a fetish, and Koneko fits the catgirl fetish in some scenes.  Asia’s story is a bit tragic because she was originally a nun for the church who Rias turned into a demon after she died, and Koneko is the token Tsundere who does tend to beat Issei up whenever he’s acting pervy, but isn’t nearly as obnoxious as most Tsunderes.  None of the the girls are incredibly complex, but they are deep and interesting enough to keep viewers invested beyond just the bouncing boobs.  Also, the primary romantic interest in the series is obviously Rias.  And that segues me into the next thing that’s great about the show, the romance.  I actually liken the romance in this show to Chivalry of a Failed Knight, which came out in 2016.  It doesn’t have the most realistic romance ever, but it nevertheless feels genuine, and is incredibly engrossing.  


In fact all of the drama, despite not technically being absolutely necessary to hook people in, is engaging, and I want to see what the outcome is going to be.  While I never really have the fear that any of the main cast are going to die, and STAY dead, I still find it very enjoyable.  Especially the end of season 3, which finally had Rias and Issei kissing for the first time.  From what I’ve heard that was supposed to happen later in the light novels, and for some reason they fast tracked it in the anime adaptation, but that doesn’t bother me, because it was nice to see.  Another part of the show’s appeal is the fight scenes.  In fact, I don’t think it’s a stretch to call this a shonen battle show.  The fights bank on well animated, face paced, intense action, with tones of unique superpowers to be used against each other, and characters no only getting physically stronger but also growing as characters as they continue fighting, it’s just like a standard shonen battle anime.  


Another reason the show is so appealing, at least to me, is how it incorporates real world mythologies into its world building, specifically Norse Mythology, which is my favorite type of mythology.  While there are random devils that aren’t from any mythology, Norse Gods such as Loki and Odin, among others.  The show also represents Lucifer, Beelzebub, Leviathan, and Asmodeus, four infamous demons from the Christian Bible.  This next point is something that Mother’s Basement said in his video, but I feel like echoing it because it’s pertinent as to why I love this show, and that has to do with the type of girls that the show provides.  Harems have become extremely over saturated over the years, and because of that, in order to extend their shelf life as much as possible, writers figured out that they have to create some sort of unique twists with the girls in order to keep people interested.  


Some shows make the girls aliens, such as with the classic Tenchi Muyo and the piece of garbage DearS, others make them monster girls, such as Interviews With Monster Girls, the wonderfully lewd Monster Musume, and, let’s be honest, a shit tone of modern day harems, and others decide to make the girls angels and/or demons, such as with the underrated classic Shuffle, and of course Highschool DxD.  



The benefit of making the girls something that isn’t human is that the characters don’t have to abide by human morals, because morality, after all, is nothing more than a man made thing, and opinions about such things could be different to other species.  Not to mention, regarding the demon girls of HIghschool DxD, you would expect demons to have extremely loose, or perhaps even non existent, morals, when it comes to age, status, family, and anything else that you could possibly think of.  While the show makes it clear that these demons, or at the very least Rias, does have a concept of romance, it’s also made very clear that she wants Issei’s dick inside of her, which for many people might make it more acceptable because she’s a demon.  


And I think that also makes the loli fanservice with both Asia and Koneko less creepy, although that definitely won’t be the case with everyone.  Miina Tepes from the anime series Dance in the Vampire Bund is also a good example for this, although that one isn’t actually a harem anime.  I think that pretty much sums up every reason that I love Highschool DxD.  It’s an absolutely amazing show, and I’m so glad that season 4 is currently airing.  At the time of this writing I haven’t started watching it yet, but I will very soon.  I think it’s kind of a misunderstood show, due to the fanservice, which is really sad and unfair, because I feel that this is one of the few fanservice anime that has something for just about everyone.
